sect1.title: Miscellaneous Methods
sect1.para: Several other methods exist for special purpose tasks.

sect2.title: Fractional Seconds
sect2.para: Zend_Date supports several methods for working with time units smaller than seconds. By default, precision is set to track milliseconds, as seen using getFractionalPrecision(). To change the precision use setFractionalPrecision($precision).

sect2.title: Working with Timezones
sect2.para: In order for a date to be rendered in a localized manner, a timezone must be known first. The default timezone is always GMT/UTC. To examine an object's timezone use getTimeZone()). To change an object's timezone, use setTimeZone()).

sect2.title: public static now()
sect2.para: This convenience function is equivalent to new Zend_Date().

sect2.title: Leap Years
sect2.para: Use isLeapYear() to determine if the current object is a leap year, or use Zend_Date::checkLeapYear($year) to check $year, which can be a string, integer, or instance of Zend_Date.

sect2.title: Today, Tomorrow, Yesterday
sect2.para: Conveniently, Zend_Date provides the ability to check localized dates against the common tests for isToday(), isYesterday(), and isTomorrow().
